summary.long: 1 Kings is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Now King David was old. He had lived many years. They covered him with clothes, but he could not keep warm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his servants said to him, “Let a young woman who has never had a man be found for my lord the king. Let her help the king and become his nurse. And let her lie in your arms, that my lord the king may be warm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they looked through all the land of Israel for a beautiful girl, and found Abishag the Shunammite. And they brought her to the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The girl was very beautiful. She became the king’s nurse and helped him. But the king did not have sex with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Haggith’s son Adonijah honored himself, saying, “I will be king.” So he made war-wagons and horsemen ready for himself, with fifty men to run in front of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His father had never troubled him at any time by asking, “Why have you done this?” He was a very good-looking man also, and was born next after Absalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke with Joab the son of Zeruiah and with Abiathar the religious leader. And they followed Adonijah and helped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Zadok the religious leader, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, Nathan the man of God, Shimei, Rei, and David’s strong men, were not with Adonijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adonijah killed sheep and cattle and fat animals by the stone of Zoheleth, beside En-rogel. He asked all his brothers, the king’s sons and all the king’s men of Judah to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he did not ask Nathan the man of God, Benaiah, the strong men or his brother Solomon to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Nathan said to Solomon’s mother Bathsheba, “Have you not heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith has become king, and our lord David does not know it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now come, let me give you words of wisdom and save your life and the life of your son Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to King David and say to him, ‘My lord, O king, have you not promised your woman servant, saying, “For sure your son Solomon will be king after me. He will sit on my throne”? Why then has Adonijah become king?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While you are still there speaking with the king, I will come in after you and tell him your words are true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Bathsheba went to the king in his room. The king was very old, and Abishag the Shunammite was helping him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bathsheba put her face to the ground in front of the king. And the king said, “What do you wish?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to him, “My lord, you promised your woman servant by the Lord your God, saying, ‘For sure your son Solomon will be king after me. He will sit on my throne.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, see, Adonijah is king. And my lord the king, you do not know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has killed many cattle and sheep and fat animals. He has asked all the king’s sons and Abiathar the religious leader and Joab the captain of the army to come. But he has not asked your servant Solomon to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are on you. They are waiting for you to tell them who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or else as soon as my lord the king is dead, I and my son Solomon will be thought of as wrong-doers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While she was still speaking with the king, Nathan the man of God came in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told the king, “Here is Nathan who speaks for God.” When Nathan came in front of the king, he put his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Nathan said, “My lord the king, have you said, ‘Adonijah will be king after me, and he will sit on my throne’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he has gone down today and has killed many cattle and sheep and fat animals. He has asked all the king’s sons and the captains of the army and Abiathar the religious leader to come. They are eating and drinking with him, and are saying, ‘Long live King Adonijah!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he has not asked me your servant, Zadok the religious leader, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, or your servant Solomon, to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has this been done by my lord the king? Have you not shown your servants who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King David said, “Call Bathsheba to me.” And she came and stood in front of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king made a promise and said, “As the Lord lives, Who has saved me from all trouble,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I promised you by the Lord the God of Israel, saying, ‘Your son Solomon will be king after me. He will sit on my throne in my place.’ And I will even do so this day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bathsheba put her face to the ground in front of the king and said, “May my lord King David live forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King David said, “Call to me Zadok the religious leader, Nathan the man of God, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada.” And they came to the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king said to them, “Take the servants of your lord with you. Have my son Solomon go on my own horse. And bring him down to Gihon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Zadok the religious leader and Nathan the man of God set him apart there as king over Israel. Sound the horn and say, ‘Long live King Solomon!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then come up after him. He will come and sit on my throne and be king in my place. For I have chosen him to be ruler over Israel and Judah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king, “Let it be so! May the Lord, the God of my lord the king, say so!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord be with Solomon as He has been with my lord the king. May He make his throne greater than the throne of my lord King David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Zadok the religious leader, Nathan the man of God, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the Cherethites, and the Pelethites went down to Gihon. And they brought Solomon with them, on King David’s horse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There Zadok the religious leader took the horn of oil from the tent and poured it on Solomon. Then they sounded the horn and all the people said, “Long live King Solomon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people went up after him. They were playing music and were filled with joy. The earth shook with all the noise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adonijah and all who had been asked to be with him heard it as they finished eating. When Joab heard the sound of the horn, he said, “Why is there such a noise in the city?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the religious leader came. Adonijah said, “Come in, for you are a man to be trusted, and bring good news.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jonathan said to Adonijah, “No! Our lord King David has made Solomon king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king has sent with him Zadok the religious leader, Nathan the man of God, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the Cherethites and the Pelethites. And they have made him travel on the king’s horse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zadok the religious leader and Nathan the man of God have set him apart as king in Gihon. They have come up from there filled with joy, so there is much noise in the city. This is the noise you have heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon sits upon the throne of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is more, the king’s servants came to give honor to our lord King David, saying, ‘May your God make the name of Solomon better than your name and his throne greater than your throne!’ And the king put his face down upon the bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king said, ‘Thanks be to the Lord, the God of Israel. He has given one to sit on my throne today while my own eyes see it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all those with Adonijah were filled with fear. Each of them got up and went his own way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Adonijah was afraid of Solomon. He got up and went and took hold of the horns of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon was told, “See, Adonijah is afraid of King Solomon. See, he has taken hold of the horns of the altar, saying, ‘Let King Solomon promise me today that he will not put his servant to death with the sword.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon said, “If he will be a man of worth, not one of his hairs will fall to the ground. But if he is found to be bad, he will die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Solomon sent men to bring him down from the altar. Adonijah came and put his face to the ground in front of King Solomon. And Solomon said to him, “Go to your house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David’s time to die was near, he told his son Solomon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am going the way of all the earth. So be strong. Show yourself to be a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do what the Lord your God tells you. Walk in His ways. Keep all His Laws and His Word, by what is written in the Law of Moses. Then you will do well in all that you do and in every place you go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord will keep His promise to me. He has said to me, ‘Your sons must be careful of their way, to walk before Me in truth with all their heart and soul. If they do, you will never be without a man on the throne of Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you know what Zeruiah’s son Joab did to me. You know what he did to the two captains of the armies of Israel. He killed Abner the son of Ner, and Amasa the son of Jether in the time of peace as if it were in the time of war. He put the blood of war on his belt and on the shoes of his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So act with wisdom. Do not let his gray hair go down to the grave in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But show kindness to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite. Let them be among those who eat at your table. For they helped me when I ran from your brother Absalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, there is with you Shimei the son of Gera the Benjamite, of Bahurim. It was he who spoke bad words against me on the day I went to Mahanaim. But when he came down to me at the Jordan, I promised him by the Lord, saying, ‘I will not put you to death with the sword.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not let him go without being punished. For you are a wise man. You will know what you should do to him. Bring his gray hair down to the grave with blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David died and was buried in the city of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had ruled over Israel forty years. Seven years he ruled in Hebron. And thirty-three years he ruled in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon sat on the throne of his father David and things went well for the nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Solomon’s mother Bathsheba. She said, “Do you come in peace?” And he said, “Yes, in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “I have something to say to you.” And she said, “Speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “You know that the nation was mine. All Israel thought I would be king. But the nation has become my brother’s, for it was his from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have one thing to ask of you. Do not say no to me.” And she said to him, “Speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I beg you, speak to Solomon the king. For he will not say no to you. Ask him to give me Abishag the Shunammite as a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bathsheba said, “Very well. I will speak to the king for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Bathsheba went to speak to King Solomon for Adonijah. The king stood up to meet her, bowed in front of her, then sat on his throne. He had a seat brought in for the king’s mother, and she sat on his right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “I am asking you for one small thing. Do not say no to me.” And the king said to her, “Ask, my mother. I will not say no to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she said, “Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to your brother Adonijah as his wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Solomon answered his mother, “Why are you asking me to give Abishag the Shunammite to Adonijah? Ask me to give him the nation also! For he is my older brother. And Abiathar the religious leader and Joab the son of Zeruiah are on his side!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Solomon swore by the Lord, saying, “May God do so to me and more, if Adonijah has not asked for this against his own life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has given me my place on the throne of my father David. He has made me a house as He promised. And as the Lord lives, for sure Adonijah will be put to death today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and he went to Adonijah and killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said to Abiathar the religious leader, “Go to your own fields at Anathoth, for you should be put to death. But I will not have you killed at this time. Because you carried the special box of the Lord God in front of my father David. And you shared in all of my father’s suffering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon stopped Abiathar from being religious leader for the Lord any longer. This was done to keep the word of the Lord, which God had spoken about the family of Eli in Shiloh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the news came to Joab. For Joab had followed Adonijah, but he had not followed Absalom. And Joab ran to the tent of the Lord and took hold of the horns of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Solomon was told that Joab had run to the tent of the Lord, and was beside the altar. Then Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, “Go and kill him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah came to the tent of the Lord. He said to Joab, “The king says to come out.” But Joab said, “No! I will die here.” So Benaiah returned to the king and said, “This is what Joab said. This is how he answered me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king said to him, “Do as he has said. Kill him and bury him. In this way you will take away from me and my father’s house the blood of those killed by Joab without a reason.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will return Joab’s acts of killing upon his own head. Because Joab killed two men who were right and good and better than he. He killed them with the sword while my father David did not know it. He killed Abner the son of Ner, captain of the army of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, captain of the army of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So their blood will be on the head of Joab and on the head of his children forever. But may there be peace from the Lord forever to David and his children, his house and his throne.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up and killed Joab. He was buried at his own house in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada over the army in Joab’s place. And the king put Zadok the religious leader in the place of Abiathar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king sent for Shimei and said to him, “Build a house for yourself in Jerusalem and live there. Do not leave there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For on the day you go out and cross the river Kidron, you will know for sure that you will die. Your blood will be on your own head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shimei said to the king, “What you say is good. Your servant will do as my lord the king has said.” So Shimei lived in Jerusalem many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at the end of three years, two of Shimei’s servants ran away to Achish the son of Maacah, king of Gath. Shimei was told, “See, your servants are in Gath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Shimei got up and made his donkey ready to travel. And he went to Achish in Gath to look for his servants. Shimei went and brought his servants from Gath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon was told that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath and had returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king sent for Shimei and said to him, “Did I not make you promise by the Lord and tell you of danger, saying, ‘You will know for sure that on the day you leave and go anywhere, you will die’? And you said to me, ‘What you have said is good.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then why have you not kept the promise of the Lord? Why have you not done what I told you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king said to Shimei, “You know in your heart all the bad things you did to my father David. So the Lord will return your sin upon your own head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But good will come to King Solomon. The throne of David will keep its place before the Lord forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king told Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and he went out and killed Shimei. The nation was put under the rule of Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon made a marriage agreement with Pharaoh the king of Egypt. He took Pharaoh’s daughter and brought her to the city of David. She stayed there until he had finished building his own house, and the house of the Lord, and the wall around Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were still giving their different gifts on altars, because no house had yet been built for the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Solomon loved the Lord. He walked in the Laws of his father David. But he gave gifts and burned special perfume on different altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king went to give a gift on the altar in worship at Gibeon, for that was where the most important altar was. Solomon gave a thousand burnt gifts on that altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord came to Solomon in a special dream in Gibeon during the night. God said, “Ask what you wish Me to give you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon said, “You have shown great loving-kindness to Your servant David my father because he was faithful and right and good and pure in heart before You. And You have kept for him this great and lasting love. You have given him a son to sit on his throne this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, O Lord my God, You have made Your servant king in place of my father David. But I am only a little child. I do not know how to start or finish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your servant is among Your people which You have chosen. They are many people. There are too many people to number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So give Your servant an understanding heart to judge Your people and know the difference between good and bad. For who is able to judge Your many people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It pleased the Lord that Solomon had asked this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God said to him, “You have asked this, and have not asked for a long life for yourself. You have not asked for riches, or for the life of those who hate you. But you have asked for understanding to know what is right. Because you have asked this,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have done what you said. See, I have given you a wise and understanding heart. No one has been like you before, and there will be no one like you in the future.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I give you what you have not asked, also. I give you both riches and honor. So there will be no king like you all your days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you walk in My ways and keep My Laws and Word as your father David did, I will allow you to live a long time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon awoke, and saw it was a dream. He came to Jerusalem and stood before the Lord’s special box of the agreement. There he gave burnt gifts and peace gifts, and made a special supper for all his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then two women who sold the use of their bodies came to the king and stood in front of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the women said, “O my lord, this woman and I live in the same house. And I gave birth to a child while she was in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day after I gave birth, this woman gave birth to a child also. And we were alone. There was no one else with us in the house. There were only the two of us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This woman’s son died during the night, because she lay on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she got up in the night and took my son from my side while I was asleep. She laid him in her arms, and her dead son in my arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I got up in the morning to nurse my son, I saw that he was dead. But when I came nearer and looked, I saw that he was not my son who was born to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the other woman said, “No! The living one is my son, and the dead one is your son.” But the first woman said, “No! The dead one is your son and the living one is my son.” They spoke this way in front of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said, “The one says, ‘This is my son who is living, and your son is the dead one.’ The other says, ‘No! Your son is the dead one. My son is the living one.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king said, “Bring me a sword.” So they brought a sword to the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king said, “Divide the living child in two. Give half to the one woman and half to the other.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the mother of the living child had much pity for her son and said to the king, “O, my lord, give her the living child. Do not kill him.” But the other woman said, “He will not be mine or yours. Divide him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king answered and said, “Give the first woman the living child. Do not kill him. She is his mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all Israel heard how the king had decided, they were afraid of him. For they saw that the wisdom of God was in him, to do what is right and fair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now King Solomon was the king of all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the king’s men. Azariah the son of Zadok was the religious leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shisha’s sons Elihoreph and Ahijah were the heads of meetings. Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was the one who wrote down the things of the nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was captain of the army. Zadok and Abiathar were religious leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azariah the son of Nathan was over the leaders. Zabud the son of Nathan was a religious leader and the king’s friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahishar was head of the king’s house. And Adoniram the son of Abda was head of the men who were made to work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon had twelve men over all Israel, who brought food for the king and those of his house. Each man had to bring food for one month in the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were their names. There was Ben-hur, in the hill country of Ephraim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ben-deker in Makaz. There were Shaalbim, Beth-shemesh, Elonbeth-hanan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ben-hesed in Arrubboth (Socoh and all the land of Hepher belonged to him),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ben-abinadab in all Naphath-Dor (Solomon’s daughter Taphath was his wife).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was Baana the son of Ahilud, in Taanach and Megiddo and all Beth-shean which is beside Zarethan below Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah as far as the other side of Jokmeam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was Bengeber in Ramoth-gilead. (The towns of Manasseh’s son Jair which are in Gilead were his. And he had the land of Argob in Bashan, where there were sixty big cities with walls and locks of brass.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was Ahinadab the son of Iddo in Mahanaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahimaaz in Naphtali (who married Solomon’s daughter Basemath),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Baana the son of Hushai in Asher and Bealoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah in Issachar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shimei the son of Ela in Benjamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Geber the son of Uri in the land of Gilead, the country of Sihon king of the Amorites and of Og king of Bashan. He was the only leader in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were many people in Judah and Israel, as much as the sand beside the sea. They were eating and drinking and full of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon ruled over all the nations from the Euphrates River to the land of the Philistines and to the land of Egypt. They brought taxes and worked for Solomon all the days of his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The food brought to Solomon for one day was 300 baskets of fine flour, 600 baskets of seeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ten fat bulls, twenty grass-fed bulls, 100 sheep, and deer, gazelles, roebucks and fat birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon ruled over everything west of the Euphrates River, from Tiphsah to Gaza. He ruled over all the kings west of the Euphrates. And he had peace around him on all sides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judah and Israel were safe. Every man was safe under his vine and fig tree, from Dan to Beersheba, all the days of Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon had 40,000 rooms for his war-wagon horses, and 12,000 horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those leaders brought food for King Solomon and all who came to his table, each during his month. They made sure nothing was missing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought barley and straw for the fast horses and the war-wagon horses, where it was needed. Each man did the work he had been given to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God gave Solomon wisdom and much understanding and learning, as much as the sand beside the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon’s wisdom was greater than the wisdom of all the people of the east and all the wisdom of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was wiser than all men, than Ethan the Ezrahite, Heman, Calcol, Darda, and the sons of Mahol. His name was known in all the nations around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke 3,000 wise sayings and wrote 1,005 songs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke of trees, from the cedar in Lebanon to the hyssop that grows on the wall. He spoke of animals, birds, things that moved upon the ground, and fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men came from all nations to hear the wisdom of Solomon. They came from all the kings of the earth who had heard of his wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Hiram the king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon, when he heard that they had set him apart to be king in place of his father. Hiram had always loved David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon sent word to Hiram, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You know that my father David was not able to build a house for the name of the Lord his God because of the wars all around him. The Lord had not yet put those who hated him under his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now the Lord my God has given me rest on every side. There is no trouble or anything bad happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I plan to build a house for the name of the Lord my God. Because the Lord said to my father David, ‘I will set your son on your throne in your place. He will build the house for My name.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So tell them to cut cedar trees of Lebanon for me. My servants will join yours. And I will give you whatever you say to pay your servants. For you know that there is no one among us who knows how to cut trees like the Sidonians.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Hiram heard the words of Solomon, he was filled with joy and said, “Thanks be to the Lord today. He has given to David a wise son to rule this great people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hiram sent word to Solomon, saying, “I have heard the news you have sent me. I will do what you want with the cedar and cypress trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My servants will bring them down from Lebanon to the sea. I will make them ready to go on the sea to the place you choose. I will have them broken up there, and you can carry them away. Then you will do what I wish by giving food to those of my house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hiram gave Solomon as much as he wanted of the cedar and cypress trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon gave Hiram 200,000 baskets of grain as food for those of his house, and 200 jars of beaten oil. Solomon gave this to Hiram each year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord gave wisdom to Solomon, just as He promised him. There was peace between Hiram and Solomon, and they made an agreement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now King Solomon made men work for him from all Israel. There were 30,000 men made to work for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent them to Lebanon, 10,000 men each month. They were in Lebanon one month and at home two months. Adoniram ruled those who were made to work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Solomon had 70,000 men to carry loads, and 80,000 stone cutters in the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he had 3,300 men who were leaders of the work, and who ruled over the people doing the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then as the king told them, they cut out large stones of much worth for the house of God to be built on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon’s builders and Hiram’s builders and the Gebalites cut them. They made the wood and the stones ready to build the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the 480th year after the people of Israel came out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon’s rule over Israel, in the month of Ziv, the second month, he began to build the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The house which King Solomon built for the Lord was as long as thirty long steps, as wide as ten long steps, and eight times taller than a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All along the front of the House of God was a porch ten long steps long and five long steps wide. It was as long as the house was wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made windows for the house with beautiful cross-pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a building of rooms against the outer walls of three sides of the house. These rooms were three floors high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bottom floor was as wide as three steps. The second floor was as wide as three long steps. And the third floor was as wide as four steps. For around the outside of the house he made places for the large wood cross-pieces to rest on. That way they would not need to be put into holes in the walls of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The house was built of stone that was cut at the place where it was taken from the ground. There was no noise of a hammer or an ax or any iron object heard in the house while it was being built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The door for the first floor room was on the right side of the house. They would go up steps to the second floor, and from the second to the third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he built the house and finished it. And he made the roof of the house of large pieces of cedar wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built the three floors against the outside wall of the house. Each one was as high as a man could raise his hand. They were joined to the house with big pieces of cedar wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to Solomon, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you obey My Laws and keep My Word, then I will keep My promise with you, which I spoke to your father David about this house you are building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will live among the sons of Israel. And I will not leave My people Israel alone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon built the house and finished it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built the walls of the house on the inside with pieces of cedar wood. He put wood over the inside walls from the floor of the house to the roof. And he put pieces of cypress wood over the floor of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An inside room called the most holy place was built in the back part of the house with pieces of cedar wood, from the floor to the roof and as wide as ten long steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the house, the center room in front of the most holy place, was as long as twenty long steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was cedar on the house within, cut to look like gourds and open flowers. It was all cedar. No stone was seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he built the most holy place inside the house, in which to put the special box of the agreement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The most holy place was as long as ten long steps, as wide as ten long steps, and more than five times taller than a man. He covered it with pure gold. And he covered the altar with cedar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon covered the inside of the house with pure gold. He crossed the front of the most holy place with chains of gold, and he covered it with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He covered the whole house with gold, until all the house was finished. And he covered the whole altar by the most holy place with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the most holy place he made two cherubim of olive wood. Each one was almost three times taller than a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One wing of the cherub was as long as three steps. And the other wing of the cherub was as long as three steps. It was as far as five long steps from the end of one wing to the end of the other wing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was as much as five long steps between the ends of the wings of the other cherub also. Both the cherubim were the same height, length and width, and they looked alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of the cherubim was almost three times taller than a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the cherubim in the most holy place of the house. The wings of the cherubim were spread out. The wing of the one cherub was touching the one wall, and the wing of the other cherub was touching the other wall. So their wings were touching each other in the center of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He covered the cherubim with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he cut pictures in all the walls around the house to look like cherubim, palm trees and open flowers, in the center room and the most holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He covered the floor of the house with gold, in the center room and the most holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made doors of olive wood for the most holy place. The top and sides of the door had five sides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cut pictures in the two doors of olive wood, to look like cherubim, palm trees and open flowers, and covered them with gold. He spread the gold on the cherubim and on the palm trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the doorway of the center room he made four-sided side pieces of olive wood
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two doors of cypress wood. Each door had two moving parts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On them he cut pictures of cherubim, palm trees and open flowers. And he covered the pictures with an even covering of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built the inside place with three rows of cut stone and one row of large pieces of cedar wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourth year the base of the house was laid in the month of Ziv.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year, in the month of Bul, the eighth month, all the parts of the house were finished just as all the plans had been made. Solomon took seven years to build it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon was building his own house thirteen years, and he finished all of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built the house of the trees of Lebanon. It was as long as fifty long steps, as wide as twenty-five long steps, and eight times taller than a man. It was built on four rows of cedar pillars, and large pieces of cedar wood lying on top of the pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was covered with cedar above the rooms that were on the forty-five pillars, fifteen in each row.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were three rows of special windows on one side, and three rows of windows on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the doors and windows were as high as they were wide. And there were three rows of windows on each side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made a room for walking through of large pillars. It was as long as twenty-five long steps, and as wide as fifteen long steps. There was a porch in front with pillars, and an overhead covering in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a room for the throne, the room for judging. It was where he would decide between right and wrong. It was covered with cedar from the floor to the roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His own house where he was to live, in the place behind the throne room, was built the same way. Solomon made a house like this room for Pharaoh’s daughter also, whom he had married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were made with stones of much worth, each one cut to be put into place. They were cut with saws, inside and outside, from the very base to the top of the roof, and from the outside to the largest room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The base of the building was made with large stones of much worth. The stones were as long as five long steps, and four long steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Above this were stones of much worth, cut to go well into place, and cedar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The largest room had three rows of cut stone around it, and a row of cedar pieces. The same was around the open space in the house of the Lord, and the porch of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now King Solomon brought Hiram from Tyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hiram was the son of a woman whose husband had died, from the family of Naphtali. His father was a man of Tyre, who worked with brass. He was filled with wisdom and understanding and much learning for doing any work with brass. So he came to King Solomon, and did all his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the two pillars of brass. One of them was five times taller than a man. And the length around each of them was as far as six long steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made two top pieces of melted brass to set on the tops of the pillars. One piece to go on top was as tall as a man can raise his hand. And the other piece to go on top was as tall as a man can raise his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made nets of network and turned strings of chain-work for the pieces on top of the pillars. There were seven for one top piece, and seven for the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hiram made the pillars. There were two rows of pomegranates around each network, to cover the top pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the top pieces on the pillars of the porch were made to look like lily flowers, as tall as a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The top pieces were upon the two pillars, and above the round part beside the network. There were 200 pomegranates in rows around both top pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set up the pillars at the porch of the house. He set up the right pillar and called it Jachin. And he set up the left pillar and called it Boaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The top pieces on the pillars were made to look like lily flowers. So the work of the pillars was finished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he made a large brass water pool. It was round, and as wide as five long steps. It was as tall as a man can raise his hand. And the length around it was as far as fifteen long steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gourds went around the top of the pool. There were ten of them for every cubit. The gourds were in two rows, and made right in with the pool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pool stood on the backs of twelve bulls made of brass. Three looked to the north. Three looked to the west. Three looked to the south. And three looked to the east. The water was set on top of them, and their back parts turned toward the center.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The side of the pool was as far through as the width of a man’s open hand. Its round top was made like the top of a cup, like a lily flower. It could hold 2,000 bottles of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made the ten stands of brass. Each stand was as long as two long steps, as wide as two long steps, and as high as a man’s neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how the stands were made. They had sides of the same length between the cross-pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the side pieces between the cross-pieces were lions, bulls and cherubim. On the side pieces, both above and below the lions and bulls, there were round pieces of hanging work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each stand had four brass wheels on straight pieces of brass. At the four corners were pieces to hold up the basin. These pieces were made of melted brass with round pieces at each side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its opening inside the crown at the top was a cubit. It was round like a pillar, one and a half cubits deep. There were pictures cut on its opening. And their sides were not round, but had four sides of the same length.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Under the sides were the four wheels. The pieces that held the wheels were on the stand. The height of a wheel was one and a half cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wheels were made like the wheel of a war-wagon. The straight pieces which held the wheels, the outside of the wheels, their crosspieces and their center pieces were all made of one piece of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were four pieces at the four corners of each stand to hold it up. These were of one piece with the stands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A narrow piece went all the way around the top that held it up and the sides were of one piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cut pictures of cherubim, lions and palm trees in the plates of the parts that held it up and on its sides, where there was room. And there were pictures all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the ten stands like this. All of them were made alike. They had the same length, width and height, and looked the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made ten basins of brass. One basin held 40 bottles of water. Each one was as wide as two long steps. And one basin was on each of the ten stands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he put the stands in place. Five were on the south side of the house, and five were on the north side of the house. And he set the large basin of brass on the southeast corner of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hiram made the basins, and the objects for digging, and the pots. So Hiram finished doing all the work for King Solomon in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the two pillars, and the two pots of the top pieces on the top of the two pillars. And he made the two networks to cover the two pots of the pieces on top of the pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the 400 pomegranates for the two networks. There were two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two pots of the pieces on top of the pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the ten stands with the ten basins on top of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the large basin and the twelve bulls under it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the pails, the objects for digging, and the pots. All these things which Hiram made for King Solomon in the house of the Lord were made of shining brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king made them in the plain of the Jordan, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zarethan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon did not weigh any of the objects, because there were too many. The weight of the brass was not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon made all the holy things which were in the house of the Lord. He made the gold altar and the gold table for the bread before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the lamp-stands of pure gold. There were five on the right side and five on the left side, in front of the most holy place. He made the flowers and the lamps and their objects out of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the cups, the objects to put out the lamps, the pots, the dishes for special perfume, and the fire-holders, of pure gold. He made the hinges of gold, for the doors of the most holy place and for the doors of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the work that King Solomon did in the house of the Lord was finished. And Solomon brought in the things which had been set apart by his father David, the silver and the gold and the holy things. He put them in the store-houses of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Solomon gathered together the leaders of Israel in front of him in Jerusalem. He gathered together all the heads of the families and the leaders of the fathers’ houses of the sons of Israel. They gathered to bring up the Lord’s special box of the agreement from Zion the city of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the men of Israel gathered to King Solomon at the special supper in the seventh month, Ethanim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the leaders of Israel came, and the religious leaders took up the Lord’s special box of the agreement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought up the Lord’s special box of the agreement, the meeting tent, and all the holy objects which were in the tent. The religious leaders and the Levites brought them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Solomon and all the people of Israel, who were gathered to him, were with him in front of the special box. They killed so many sheep and cattle on the altar that their number could not be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the religious leaders brought the Lord’s special box of the agreement to its place. They brought it into the most holy place of the house, under the wings of the cherubim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cherubim spread their wings over the place of the special box. The cherubim made a covering above the special box and its special pieces of wood used for carrying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The carrying pieces were so long that the ends of them could be seen from the holy place in front of the most holy place. But they could not be seen from outside. They are there to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was nothing in the special box except the two stone writings which Moses put there at Horeb. There the Lord had made an agreement with the people of Israel when they came out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the religious leaders came from the holy place, the cloud filled the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the religious leaders were not able to stand there to do their work because of the cloud. For the shining-greatness of the Lord filled the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon said, “The Lord has said that He would live in the thick cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have built You an honored house, a place for You to live forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king turned around and prayed that good would come to all the people of Israel, while all the people of Israel stood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Thanks be to the Lord, the God of Israel. He spoke with His mouth to my father David. And He has kept His promise with His hand, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ’Since the day I brought My people Israel out of Egypt, I did not choose a city of all the families of Israel in which to build a house that My name might be there. But I chose David to be king over My people Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was in the heart of my father David to build a house for the name of the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to my father David, ‘Because it was in your heart to build a house for My name, you did well that it was in your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you will not build the house. Your son who will be born to you will build the house for My name.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord has kept His promise which He made. For I have taken my father David’s place and sit on the throne of Israel, as the Lord promised. And I have built the house for the name of the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There I have made a place for the special box in which is the agreement of the Lord. He made it when He brought them from the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon stood before the altar of the Lord. And in front of all the people of Israel he lifted his hands toward heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “O Lord, God of Israel, there is no God like You in heaven above or on earth below. You are keeping Your agreement and are showing loving-kindness to Your servants who walk in Your ways with all their heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have kept Your promise to Your servant, my father David. Yes, You have spoken with Your mouth, and have done it with Your hand, as it is this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, O Lord, God of Israel, keep Your promise to my father David when You said to him, ‘You will not be without a man to sit on the throne of Israel, if only your sons are careful to walk in My ways as you have walked.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O God of Israel, let Your Word be made sure, which You have spoken to Your servant, my father David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But is it true that God will live on the earth? See, heaven and the highest heaven are not big enough to hold You. How much less this house which I have built!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But keep in mind the prayer of Your servant, O Lord my God. Listen to the cry and to the prayer which Your servant prays to You today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Open Your eyes night and day toward this house, toward the place of which You have said, ‘My name will be there.’ Listen to the prayer Your servant will pray toward this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to the prayer of Your servant and of Your people Israel, when they pray toward this place. Hear in heaven where You live. Hear and forgive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man sins against his neighbor and has to make a promise, and he comes and makes a promise at Your altar in this house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear in heaven and act. Judge Your servants. Punish the guilty forever by bringing his actions upon his own head, and free from guilt the one who is right and good, by returning his good to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When Your people Israel do not win in battle over those who hate them, because they have sinned against You, but if they turn to You again and call on Your name and pray to You in this house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear in heaven. Forgive the sin of Your people Israel. And return them to the land You gave to their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the heavens are shut up and give no rain because they have sinned against You, if they pray toward this place and call on Your name and turn from their sin when You bring trouble to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear in heaven. Forgive the sin of Your servants and of Your people Israel. Teach them the good way in which they should walk. And send rain on Your land, which You have given to Your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If there is no food in the land, if there is a bad sickness, if there are diseases or locusts or grasshoppers that kill the plants, if the armies of those who hate Your people gather around their cities, or whatever trouble or sickness there is,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whatever prayer is made by any man or by all Your people Israel, each knowing the trouble of his own heart and spreading his hands toward this house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear in heaven where You are. Forgive, and act. Give to each the pay he has earned by all his ways. You know his heart. You alone know the hearts of all the children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May they fear You all the days they live in the land You have given to our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a stranger who is not of Your people Israel comes from a far country because of You,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for they will hear of Your great name and Your powerful hand and Your long arm,) when he comes and prays toward this house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: hear in heaven where You are. Do all the stranger asks of You. So all the peoples of the earth may know Your name and fear You, as do Your people Israel. Then they may know that this house I have built is called by Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When your people go out to battle against those who hate them, by whatever way You send them, when they pray to the Lord toward the city You have chosen and the house I have built for Your name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear their prayer and their cry in heaven. See that the right thing is done to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When they sin against You (for there is no man who does not sin), and You will be angry with them, give them to those who hate them, so they will be taken away to another land, far away or near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they do some thinking in the land where they have been taken, and pray to You in the land of those who hate them, saying, ‘We have sinned and have done wrong and have done bad things,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if they return to You with all their heart and soul in the land of those who hate them and have taken them there, and if they pray to You toward their land which You have given to their fathers, the city You have chosen, and the house I have built for Your name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hear their prayer in heaven where You are. See that the right thing is done to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forgive Your people who have sinned against You and all the wrong they have done against You. Give them loving-pity in front of those who have taken them away, that they may have loving-pity on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they are Your people and Your children whom You have brought out of Egypt, from the iron fire-place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Your eyes be open to the prayer of Your servant and of Your people Israel. Listen to them when they call to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For You have divided them from all the peoples of the earth as Your children. You have done what You said You would do through Your servant Moses, when You brought our fathers out of Egypt, O Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Solomon had finished praying all this prayer to the Lord, he stood up in front of the altar of the Lord. He had been on his knees with his hands lifted toward heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stood and prayed with a loud voice that good would come to all the people of Israel who were gathered together. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thanks be to the Lord. He has given rest to His people Israel. He has done all that He promised. Every word has come true of all His good promise, which He promised through His servant Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord our God be with us, as He was with our fathers. May He not leave us alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May He turn our hearts to Him, to walk in all His ways, and to keep all His Word and all His Laws, which He told our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May these words of mine, which I have prayed to the Lord, be near to the Lord our God day and night. May He see that the right thing is done to His servant and His people Israel, day by day as we have need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the peoples of the earth may know that the Lord is God. There is no other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So let your whole heart be true to the Lord our God. Walk in His Laws and keep His Word, just as you are doing today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king and all Israel with him gave a gift in worship to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon gave 22,000 cattle and 120,000 sheep as a peace gift to the Lord. So the king and all the people of Israel set apart the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same day the king set apart the center of the open space that was in front of the house of the Lord. For there he gave the burnt gift and the grain gift and the fat of the peace gifts. Because the brass altar before the Lord was too small to hold the burnt gift and the grain gift and the fat of the peace gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon had the special supper at that time, and all Israel with him. There were many people gathered, from the way into Hamath to the river of Egypt. They were before the Lord our God for seven days and seven more days, fourteen days in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon sent the people away on the eighth day, and they gave thanks to the king. Then they went to their tents full of joy and glad in their hearts for all the good things the Lord had shown to His servant David and to His people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon had finished building the house of the Lord, and the king’s house, and all that he wanted to build.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord came to Solomon a second time, as He had come to him at Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to him, “I have heard your prayer which you have prayed to Me. I have set apart this house you have built by putting My name there forever. My eyes and My heart will be there always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, walk before Me as your father David walked, with a true heart doing what is right. Do all that I have told you. Obey My Laws. If you do,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will make the throne of your rule over Israel last forever. It will be just as I promised your father David, saying, ‘You will never be without a man on the throne of Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you or your sons turn away from following Me, and do not keep My Laws which I have given you, and go after other gods and worship them, if you do,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will cut off Israel from the land I have given them. And I will put away from My eyes the house which I have set apart for My name. Israel will become a word of shame among all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This house will be broken to pieces. Everyone who passes by will be surprised and make a sound of wonder, and say, ‘Why has the Lord done this to this land and to this house?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will say, ‘Because they turned away from the Lord their God, Who brought their fathers out of the land of Egypt. They took in other gods and worshiped them and served them. So the Lord has brought all this trouble upon them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of twenty years, Solomon had built the two houses, the house of the Lord and the king’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hiram king of Tyre had given Solomon all the cedar and cypress trees and gold that he wanted. Then King Solomon gave Hiram twenty cities in the land of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Hiram came out from Tyre to see the cities Solomon had given him, they did not please him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “What are these cities you have given me, my brother?” So they are called the land of Cabul to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gold Hiram sent to the king weighed as much as 120 men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now King Solomon made men work to build the house of the Lord, his own house, the Millo, the wall of Jerusalem, Hazor, Meggido and Gezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Pharaoh king of Egypt had gone up and taken Gezer and burned it with fire. He killed the Canaanites who lived in the city, and then gave it as a wedding-gift to his daughter, Solomon’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon built Gezer again, and the lower part of Beth-horon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Baalath and Tamar in the desert, in the land of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon built all the store-cities that he had, the cities for his war-wagons, the cities for his horsemen, and all he wanted to build in Jerusalem, in Lebanon, and in all the land under his rule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were people left of the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites and the Jebusites, who were not of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their children were left after them in the land. The people of Israel were not able to destroy all of them. So Solomon made these people work for him, even to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Solomon did not make the people of Israel work for him. For they were men of war, his servants, his rulers, his captains, his war-wagon drivers, and his horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the heads of the captains over Solomon’s work. There were 550 of them who ruled over the people doing the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Pharaoh’s daughter went up from the city of David to her own house which Solomon had built for her. Then he built the Millo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times a year Solomon gave burnt gifts and peace gifts on the altar he built to the Lord. He burned special perfume on the altar before the Lord. So he finished the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Solomon built a group of ships in Ezion-geber, near Eloth on the shore of the Red Sea, in the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hiram sent his servants with the ships, sailors who knew the sea. He sent them with the servants of Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to Ophir and brought out gold weighing as much as 420 small men. And they brought it to King Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the queen of Sheba heard about the wisdom Solomon had from the Lord, she came to test him with hard questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She came to Jerusalem and many people came with her. She brought camels carrying spices and much gold and stones of much worth. When she came to Solomon, she told him all that was on her mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Solomon answered all her questions. There was nothing hidden from the king which he could not make plain to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen of Sheba saw all the wisdom of Solomon, the house he had built,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the food on his table, and his many servants seated to eat. She saw those who brought the food and how they were dressed, and those who carried his cups. She saw the steps by which he went up to the house of the Lord. And there was no more spirit in her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to the king, “The news was true that I heard in my own land about your words and your wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I did not believe the news until I came. Now my eyes have seen it. And half of it was not told to me. You have more wisdom and riches than I heard you had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How happy are your men! How happy are these your servants who stand in front of you always and hear your wisdom!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thanks be to the Lord your God Who was pleased with you and set you on the throne of Israel. Because the Lord loved Israel forever, He has made you king, to do what is fair and right and good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she gave the king gold weighing as much as 120 small men. She gave him a very large amount of spices and stones of much worth. Never again did so much spices come in as that which the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ships of Hiram brought from Ophir gold and very many almug trees and stones of much worth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king used the almug trees to make pillars for the house of the Lord and for the king’s house. And he used them to make different kinds of harps for the singers. No such almug trees have come in again or have been seen to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all she wanted, whatever she asked, as well as his gifts to her from the king’s riches. Then she and her servants returned to her own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gold which came in to Solomon in one year weighed as much as 666 small men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: besides all the gold that came from the traders and all the kings of the Arabs and the leaders of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Solomon made 200 large body coverings for battle of beaten gold. For each covering he used 600 pieces of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made 300 coverings of beaten gold, using 150 pieces of gold on each covering. The king put them in the house among the trees of Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king made a large throne of ivory and covered it with fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The throne had six steps, and a round top at its back. There were arms on each side of the seat, and two lions standing beside the arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Twelve lions stood on the six steps, one on each end. Nothing like it was made for any other king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of King Solomon’s cups were made of gold. And all the cups of the house among the trees of Lebanon were made of pure gold. None of them were made of silver. Silver was not thought of as being of much worth in the days of Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the king had a group of ships of Tarshish at sea with the ships of Hiram. Every three years the ships of Tarshish came bringing gold, silver, ivory, apes and peacocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Solomon became greater than all the kings of the earth in riches and in wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came from all over the earth to see Solomon, to hear his wisdom which God had put in his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one of them brought his gift. They brought objects of silver and gold, clothing, objects for fighting in battle, spices, horses and donkeys, so much year by year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon gathered war-wagons and horsemen. He had 1,400 war-wagons and 12,000 horsemen. He kept them in the war-wagon cities and with the king in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king made silver as easy to find as stones in Jerusalem. He made cedar trees as easy to find as the sycamore trees of the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon had horses brought from Egypt and Kue. The king’s traders bought them from Kue, each for a price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A war-wagon could be brought from Egypt for 600 pieces of silver, and a horse for 150 pieces of silver. They got them in the same way for all the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now King Solomon loved many women from other nations. He loved the daughter of Pharaoh, and Moabite, Ammonite, Edomite, Sidonian and Hittite women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were from the nations about which the Lord had said to the people of Israel, “Do not take wives from them. And do not have them take wives from you. For they will be sure to turn your heart away to follow their gods.” But Solomon held on to these women in love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had 700 wives, kings’ daughters, and 300 women who acted as his wives. And his wives turned his heart away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Solomon was old, his wives turned his heart away to follow other gods. His whole heart was not faithful to the Lord his God, as the heart of his father David had been.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Solomon followed Ashtoreth the false goddess of the Sidonians, and Milcom the hated god of the Ammonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon did what was sinful in the eyes of the Lord. He did not follow the Lord with all his heart, as his father David had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon built a high place for Chemosh the hated god of Moab, and for Molech the hated god of the sons of Ammon, on the mountain east of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did the same for all his wives from other nations, who burned special perfume and gave gifts to their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord was angry with Solomon, because Solomon’s heart had turned away from the Lord, the God of Israel. The Lord had come to him twice
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and had told him about this, that he should not follow other gods. But Solomon did not obey what the Lord had told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Solomon, “Because you have done this and have not kept My agreement and My Laws which I told you, for sure I will tear the nation from you and will give it to your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will not do it while you are alive, because of your father David. I will tear it out of the hand of your son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will not tear away all the nation. I will give one family group to your son because of My servant David, and because of Jerusalem which I have chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord sent Hadad the Edomite to make trouble for Solomon. He was of the king’s family in Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when David was in Edom, and Joab the captain of the army had gone up to bury the dead, he killed every male in Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For Joab and all Israel stayed there six months, until he had killed every male in Edom.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Hadad ran away to Egypt, together with certain Edomites of his father’s servants, while Hadad was still a young boy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came from Midian to Paran. Then they took men with them from Paran and came to Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt. Pharaoh gave Hadad a house and food and land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Hadad found much favor in the eyes of Pharaoh. So Pharaoh gave him in marriage the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tahpenes’ sister gave birth to his son Genubath, whom Tahpenes took care of in Pharaoh’s house. Genubath was in Pharaoh’s house among the sons of Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Hadad heard in Egypt that David and Joab the captain of David’s army were dead. So Hadad said to Pharaoh, “Send me away, so I may return to my own country.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh said to him, “But what have you been without while you stayed with me? Why do you want to go to your own country?” Hadad answered, “Nothing. But even so, let me go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God sent Rezon the son of Eliada against Solomon also. Rezon had run away from his owner Hadadezer king of Zobah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gathered men around him and became the leader of a group of fighters, after David killed the men of Zobah. They went to Damascus and stayed there. Rezon was made king in Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he brought trouble to Israel all the days of Solomon, together with the trouble brought by Hadad. He hated Israel and ruled over Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeroboam the son of Nebat turned against the king. Jeroboam was Solomon’s servant, an Ephraimite of Zeredah. His mother’s name was Zeruah, a woman whose husband had died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is the reason he turned against the king. Solomon built the Millo, and built a stronger wall around the city of his father David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jeroboam was a powerful soldier. When Solomon saw that the young man was a good worker, he chose him to rule over all men of the family of Joseph who were made to work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, the man who spoke for God Ahijah the Shilonite found him on the road. Ahijah had dressed himself with a new coat, and both of them were alone in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ahijah took hold of his new coat and tore it into twelve pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to Jeroboam, “Take ten pieces for yourself. For the Lord, the God of Israel, says, ‘See, I will tear the nation out of the hand of Solomon and give you ten family groups.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (But he will have one family group, because of My servant David and because of Jerusalem, the city I have chosen from all the families of Israel.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because they have turned away from Me. They have worshiped Ashtoreth the false goddess of the Sidonians, Chemosh the god of Moab, and Milcom the god of the sons of Ammon. They have not walked in My ways, doing what is right in My eyes and keeping My Laws, as his father David did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will not take the whole nation from him. I will make him ruler all the days of his life, because of My servant David whom I chose, who kept My Word and My Laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will take the nation from his son, and will give to you ten family groups.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give one family group to his son, that My servant David will have a lamp always before Me in Jerusalem, the city where I have chosen for Myself to put My name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will take you, and you will rule over whatever you want. You will be the king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to all I tell you to do. Walk in My ways. Do what is right in My eyes by keeping My Word and My Laws, as My servant David did. If you do, then I will be with you and build you a house that will last, as I built for David. And I will give Israel to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring trouble to the children of David for this, but not forever.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon tried to put Jeroboam to death. But Jeroboam got up and ran to Egypt, to Shishak king of Egypt. And he stayed in Egypt until Solomon died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon and whatever he did, and his wisdom, are they not written in the Book of the Acts of Solomon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon ruled in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Solomon died and was buried in the city of his father David. His son Rehoboam ruled in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rehoboam went to Shechem. For all Israel had come to Shechem to make him king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jeroboam the son of Nebat was still in Egypt where he had run away from King Solomon. When Jeroboam heard the news, he returned from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sent for him. Then Jeroboam and all the people of Israel came and said to Rehoboam,
