verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your father made our load heavy. Take away some of the hard work and heavy load your father put on us, and we will serve you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rehoboam said to them, “Leave for three days. Then return to me.” So the people left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Rehoboam spoke with the leaders who had worked for his father Solomon while he was still alive. He asked them, “What answer do you think I should give to these people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Help these people today. Serve them. Answer them with good words. If you do, then they will be your servants forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Rehoboam turned away from the wise words the leaders gave him. Instead he spoke with the young men who grew up with him and stood by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What answer do you say we should give to these people who have said to me, ‘Take away some of the heavy load your father put on us’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young men who grew up with him said, “This is what you should say to these people who said to you, ‘Your father made our load heavy. Now you take some of the load from us.’ You should say to them, ‘My little finger is bigger around than my father’s body!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My father gave you a heavy load. I will add to your load. My father punished you with whips. But I will punish you with scorpions.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day as the king had told them, saying, “Return to me on the third day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king was hard in his answer to them. For he turned away from the wise words the leaders had given him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke to them as he had been told by the young men. He said, “My father made your load heavy. I will add to your load. My father punished you with whips. But I will punish you with scorpions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king did not listen to the people. The Lord had let this happen, that He might keep His Word, which the Lord spoke through Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel saw that the king did not listen to them. So they said to the king, “What share do we have in David? We have no share in the son of Jesse! To your tents, O Israel! Now look after your own house, David!” So Israel went to their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for the people of Israel who lived in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam ruled over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Rehoboam sent Adoram, who ruled over those who were made to work, and all Israel killed him with stones. So King Rehoboam got on his war-wagon in a hurry to go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel turned against the family of David to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all Israel heard that Jeroboam had returned, they sent for him to meet with the people and made him king of all Israel. Only the family of Judah followed the family of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Rehoboam came to Jerusalem, he gathered all the family of Judah and the family of Benjamin. He gathered together 180,000 chosen men of war to fight against the family of Israel and return the nation to Rehoboam the son of Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Solomon’s son Rehoboam king of Judah, and to all the family of Judah and Benjamin, and to the rest of the people. Tell them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ’This is what the Lord says. “You must not go up and fight against your brothers the sons of Israel. Every man return to his house. For I have let this thing happen.”’” So they listened to the word of the Lord, and returned, as the Lord told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeroboam built Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and lived there. And he went out from there and built Penuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeroboam said in his heart, “Now the nation will return to the family of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If these people go up to give gifts in the house of the Lord at Jerusalem, then their hearts will turn to their lord Rehoboam king of Judah. They will kill me and follow Rehoboam king of Judah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king asked the leaders what he should do. And he made two calves of gold. Then he said to the people, “It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem. Here are your gods, O Israel, that brought you up from the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put one in Bethel, and the other in Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this thing became a sin. For the people went to worship in front of them, even as far as Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeroboam made houses on high places. He made religious leaders from among all the people, who were not of the sons of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a special supper on the fifteenth day of the eighth month, like the special supper which is in Judah. And he gave gifts on the altar. He did the same in Bethel, giving gifts to the calves he had made. And he placed in Bethel the religious leaders of the high places he had made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went up to the altar he had made in Bethel on the fifteenth day of the eighth month, a day he chose in his own heart. He made a special supper for the people of Israel, and went up to the altar to burn special perfume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man of God came from Judah to Bethel by the word of the Lord. Jeroboam was standing by the altar to burn special perfume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man cried against the altar by the word of the Lord, and said, “O altar, altar, this is what the Lord says. ‘See, a son will be born to the family of David. His name will be Josiah. On you he will burn the religious leaders of the high places who burn special perfume on you. Human bones will be burned on you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave a special thing to be seen the same day. He said, “This is what the Lord says will be seen. ‘See, the altar will be broken in two. And the ashes on it will be poured out.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Jeroboam heard the words the man of God cried against the altar in Bethel, he put out his hand from the altar, saying, “Take hold of him!” But his hand which he put out against him dried up. So he could not pull it back to himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The altar was broken in two and the ashes were poured out. It was the special thing to see that happened just as the man of God said it would by the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king said to the man of God, “I beg you, ask for the favor of the Lord your God. Pray for me, that my hand may be made well again.” So the man of God asked for the Lord’s favor. And the king’s hand was made well again. It became as it was before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said to the man of God, “Come home with me and have something to eat to make yourself strong again. And I will pay you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man of God said to the king, “I would not go with you if you were to give me half your house. I would not eat bread or drink water in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the word of the Lord said to me, ‘You must not eat bread or drink water or return by the way you came.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went another way. He did not return by the way he came to Bethel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an old man who spoke for God was living in Bethel. His sons came and told him all the things which the man of God had done that day in Bethel. And they told their father the words which the man had spoken to the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their father said to them, “Which way did he go?” Now his sons had seen the way which the man of God who came from Judah had gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to his sons, “Get the donkey ready for me.” So they got the donkey ready for him, and he went away on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went after the man of God and found him sitting under an oak tree. He said to him, “Are you the man of God who came from Judah?” And he said, “I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to him, “Come home with me and eat bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “I cannot return with you or go with you. I will not eat bread or drink water with you in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was told by the word of the Lord, ‘Do not eat bread or drink water there. Do not return by the way you came.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “I am a man who speaks for God like you. An angel spoke to me by the word of the Lord, saying, ‘Bring him back with you to your house, that he may eat bread and drink water.’” But he lied to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he returned with him, and ate bread in his house, and drank water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were sitting down at the table, the word of the Lord came to the man who spoke for God who had brought him back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he cried to the man of God who came from Judah, saying, “This is what the Lord says, ‘You have not obeyed the word of the Lord. You have not done what the Lord your God told you to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have returned and eaten bread and drunk water in the place the Lord said to you, “Eat no bread and drink no water.” So now your body will not come to the grave of your fathers.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had eaten bread and drunk, he got the donkey ready for the man of God whom he had brought back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had gone, a lion met him on the way and killed him. His body was thrown on the road, with the donkey standing beside it. The lion stood beside the body also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then men passed by and saw the body thrown on the road, and the lion standing beside the body. So they came and told about it in the city where the old man who spoke for God lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the man who spoke for God who had brought him back from the way heard about it, he said, “It is the man of God. He did not obey the word of the Lord. So the Lord has given him to the lion, which has torn him and killed him. It was done as had been spoken to him by the word of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to his sons, “Get the donkey ready for me.” And they got it ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went and found his body thrown on the road with the donkey and the lion standing beside it. The lion had not eaten the body or torn the donkey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man who spoke for God picked up the body of the man of God and laid it on the donkey, and returned with it to the city. He had sorrow for him and buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He laid his body in his own grave, and they had sorrow for him, saying, “O, my brother!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had buried him, he said to his sons, “When I die, bury me in the grave where the man of God is buried. Lay my bones beside his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what he cried by the word of the Lord against the altar in Bethel and against all the houses of the high places in the cities of Samaria will happen for sure.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jeroboam did not return from his sinful way. Again he made religious leaders of the high places from among all the people. He set apart any of them who were willing to be religious leaders of the high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This became the sin of the family of Jeroboam, that caused it to be cut off and destroyed from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jeroboam’s son Abijah became sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jeroboam said to his wife, “Get ready and dress yourself so no one will know that you are the wife of Jeroboam. Then go to Shiloh. Ahijah the man who speaks for God is there. He is the one who said that I would be king over these people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take ten loaves, some sweet bread and a jar of honey with you, and go to him. He will tell you what will happen to the boy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeroboam’s wife did so. She got ready and went to Shiloh, and came to Ahijah’s house. Now Ahijah could not see. His eyes were weak because he was old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord had said to Ahijah, “The wife of Jeroboam is coming to ask you about her son, for he is sick. This is what you should say to her. When she comes she will pretend to be another woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Ahijah heard the sound of her feet coming to the door, he said, “Come in, wife of Jeroboam. Why do you pretend to be another woman? For I have been given news that will be hard for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and say to Jeroboam, ‘This is what the Lord God of Israel says. “I gave you honor from among the people. I made you the leader of My people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tore the nation away from the family of David and gave it to you. But you have not been like My servant David. He kept My Laws and followed Me with all his heart. He did only what was right in My eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you have done more sinful things than all who were before you. You have gone and made for yourself other gods and objects to look like gods to make Me angry. You have put Me behind your back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I am bringing trouble upon the family of Jeroboam. I will kill every male from Jeroboam, both owned and free in Israel. I will clean away the family of Jeroboam, as one cleans away animal waste until it is all gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The dogs will eat anyone belonging to Jeroboam who dies in the city. And the birds of the air will eat anyone who dies in the field. For the Lord has said it.” ‘
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get up and go to your house. When your feet go into the city the child will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel will have sorrow for him and bury him. For he alone of Jeroboam’s family will come to the grave. Because in him there is found something good to the Lord God of Israel, in the family of Jeroboam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord will send a king over Israel who will destroy the family of Jeroboam this day and from now on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord will punish Israel, as a piece of grass is shaken in the water. He will send Israel out from this good land He gave to their fathers. He will spread them out on the other side of the Euphrates River, because they have their false gods, and have made the Lord angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will give up Israel because of the sins of Jeroboam, which he sinned and made Israel to sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeroboam’s wife got up and left and came to Tirzah. As she came to the door of the house, the child died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all Israel buried him and had sorrow for him, as the Word of God was spoken through His servant Ahijah the man who spoke for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he made war and how he ruled, are written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeroboam ruled for twenty-two years. Then he died and his son Nadab ruled in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Solomon’s son Rehoboam ruled in Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he became king. And he ruled for seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city the Lord had chosen from all the families of Israel to put His name there. The name of Rehoboam’s mother was Naamah of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah did what was sinful in the eyes of the Lord. They made Him jealous with their sins, more than all their fathers had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they built for themselves high places, holy objects and false gods on every high hill and under every green tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In their religion there were men in the land who sold the use of their bodies. They did all the hated things of the nations which the Lord drove away before the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fifth year of King Rehoboam, Shishak the king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took away the riches of the Lord’s house and the riches of the king’s house. He took everything. He even took all the body coverings of gold which Solomon had made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Rehoboam made body coverings of brass in their place. He put them in the care of the captain of the soldiers who watched the door of the king’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every time the king went into the house of the Lord, the soldiers would carry them and return them again to their room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rehoboam died and was buried with his fathers in the city of David. His mother’s name was Naamah of Ammon. And his son Abijam became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam the son of Nabat, Abijam became king over Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ruled for three years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he walked in all the sins which his father had done before him. He was not faithful to the Lord with all his heart, like the heart of his father David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem because of David. He gave him a son to rule after him and to keep Jerusalem strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because David did what was right in the eyes of the Lord. He did not turn away from anything the Lord told him to do all the days of his life, except in what happened with Uriah the Hittite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Abijam and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abijam died and they buried him in the city of David. His son Asa became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twentieth year of Jeroboam the king of Israel, Asa began to rule as king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ruled for forty-one years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Asa did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, like David his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent away the men from the land who sold the use of their bodies in their religion. He took away all the false gods his father had made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stopped his mother Maacah from being queen mother, because she had made a hated object of the false goddess Asherah. And Asa cut down her hated object and burned it at the river Kidron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high places were not taken away. But Asa was faithful to the Lord with all his heart for all his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought into the house of the Lord the holy things of his father and his own holy things, silver, gold, and holy objects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah. He built walls around Ramah to stop anyone from going out or coming in to Asa king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold which were left in the storerooms of the Lord’s house and the king’s house, and gave them to his servants. King Asa sent them to Ben-hadad the son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, who lived in Damascus. Asa said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let there be an agreement of peace between me and you, as between my father and your father. See, I have sent you a gift of silver and gold. Go and break your agreement of peace with Baasha king of Israel, so that he will leave me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ben-hadad listened to King Asa and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel. He destroyed Ijon, Dan, Abel-bethmaacah, all Chinneroth, and all the land of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Baasha heard about it, he stopped building a wall around Ramah, and stayed in Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Asa made the news known to all Judah. There was no one who did not hear it. They carried away the stones of Ramah and its pieces of wood with which Baasha had built. And King Asa used them to build Geba of Benjamin and Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of all the acts of Asa and all his strength and all he did and the cities he built, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? But when he was old he had a disease in his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asa died and was buried with his fathers in the city of his father David. His son Jehoshaphat ruled in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeroboam’s son Nadab became king of Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah. And he ruled over Israel for two years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did what was sinful in the eyes of the Lord. He walked in the way of his father, and in his sin with which he made Israel sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Baasha the son of Ahijah of the family of Issachar made plans against him. Baasha killed him at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines. Nadab and all Israel had been gathering their army in battle around Gibbethon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Baasha killed him in the third year of Asa king of Judah, and ruled in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as he was king, Baasha killed all those of the family of Jeroboam. He did not leave to Jeroboam any person alive, destroying them all. It happened just as the word of the Lord was spoken through God’s servant Ahijah the Shilonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened because of the sins of Jeroboam, which he sinned and which he made Israel sin. He made the Lord God of Israel angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Nadab and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the third year of Asa king of Judah, Baasha the son of Ahijah became king of all Israel at Tirzah. He ruled for twenty-four years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did what was sinful in the eyes of the Lord. He walked in the way of Jeroboam and in his sin which he made Israel sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I took you from the dust and gave you honor. I made you leader over My people Israel. But you have walked in the way of Jeroboam and have made My people Israel sin. You have made Me angry with their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will destroy Baasha and his house. I will make your house like the family of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The dogs will eat anyone of Baasha’s family who dies in the city. And the birds of the air will eat anyone of his who dies in the field.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the acts of Baasha and what he did and his strength, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baasha died and was buried in Tirzah. His son Elah became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came against Baasha and his house through the man who spoke for God, Jehu the son of Hanani because Baasha had done what was sinful in the eyes of the Lord. He made the Lord angry with the work of his hands, in being like the family of Jeroboam, and because he destroyed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twenty-sixth year of Asa king of Judah, Elah the son of Baasha became king of Israel at Tirzah. He ruled for two years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His servant Zimri, captain of half his war-wagons, made plans against him. Elah was at Tirzah drinking himself drunk in the family of Arza. Arza was the head of the house at Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zimri went in and hit him and killed him, in the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah. And Zimri became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he became king, as soon as he sat on his throne, he killed all those of Baasha’s house. He did not leave alive one male, of his brothers or of his friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Zimri destroyed the whole family of Baasha, as was spoken against Baasha by the word of the Lord through Jehu the man who spoke for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened because of all the sins of Baasha and his son Elah. They sinned and they made Israel sin. They made the Lord God of Israel angry with their false gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Elah and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, Zimri ruled seven days at Tirzah. Now the people were gathered against Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people who were gathered heard it said, “Zimri has made plans and has killed the king.” So all Israel made Omri, the captain of the army, the king of Israel that day among the tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Omri went with all Israel up from Gibbethon, and they gathered in battle around Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Zimri saw that the city was taken, he went into an inside room of the king’s house. And he burned the king’s house over him with fire, and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He died because of his sins. He did what was sinful in the eyes of the Lord, walking in the way of Jeroboam. And in his sin, he made Israel sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the acts of Zimri and the plan he made, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people of Israel were divided into two parts. Half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king. The other half followed Omri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people who followed Omri won over the people who followed Tibni the son of Ginath. Tibni died and Omri became king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the thirty-first year of Asa king of Judah, Omri became the king of Israel. He ruled for twelve years. He ruled six years at Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he bought the hill of Samaria from Shemer for silver weighing as much as two men. He built on the hill, and gave the city he built the name of Samaria, after the name of Shemer, the owner of the hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Omri did what was sinful in the eyes of the Lord. He acted worse than all who were before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he walked in all the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat. And in his sin he made Israel sin. They made the Lord God of Israel angry with their false gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Omri and the strength that he showed, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Omri died and was buried in Samaria. His son Ahab became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Omri’s son Ahab became king of Israel in the thirty-eighth year of Asa king of Judah. He ruled over Israel in Samaria for twenty-two years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahab the son of Omri did what was sinful in the eyes of the Lord more than all who were before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He thought it was a small thing to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat. He married Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Sidonians. Then he went to serve the false god Baal and worshiped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built an altar for Baal in the house of Baal, which he built in Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahab made an object of wood to look like the false goddess Asherah. So Ahab did more to make the Lord God of Israel angry than all the kings of Israel before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his days Hiel the Bethelite built Jericho. His first-born son Abiram died as he began to build the city. His youngest son Segub died as he put up its gates. It happened as it was told by the word of the Lord spoken by Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elijah the Tishbite, of the people who were staying in Gilead, said to Ahab, “As the Lord the God of Israel lives, before Whom I stand, for sure there will be no rain or water on the grass in the early morning these years, except by my word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Leave here and turn east. Hide yourself by the river Cherith, east of the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will drink from the river. And I have told the ravens to bring food to you there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went and did what he was told by the word of the Lord. He went and lived by the river Cherith, east of the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ravens brought him bread and meat in the morning and in the evening. And he drank from the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after a while, the river dried up, because there was no rain in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get up and go to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon, and stay there. I have told a woman there, whose husband has died, to feed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Elijah got up and went to Zarephath. When he came to the city gate, he saw a woman there gathering sticks. He called to her and said, “I ask of you, get me a little water in a jar, that I may drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As she was going to get it, he called to her, “I ask of you, bring me a piece of bread in your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she said, “As the Lord your God lives, I have no bread. I only have enough flour in the jar to fill a hand, and a little oil in the jar. See, I am gathering a few sticks so I may go in and make it ready for me and my son. Then we will eat it and die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elijah said to her, “Have no fear. Go and do as you have said. But make me a little loaf of bread from it first, and bring it out to me. Then you may make one for yourself and for your son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord God of Israel says, ‘The jar of flour will not be used up. And the jar of oil will not be empty, until the day the Lord sends rain upon the earth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she went and did what Elijah said. And she and he and those of her house ate for many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The jar of flour was not used up, and the jar of oil did not become empty. It happened as was spoken by the word of the Lord through Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this the son of the woman who owned the house became sick. His sickness was so bad that there was no breath left in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the woman said to Elijah, “What do I have to do with you, O man of God? You have come to me to have my sin be remembered, and to kill my son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Give me your son.” Then he took him from her arms and carried him up to the room on the second floor where he stayed. And he laid him on his own bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called to the Lord and said, “O Lord my God, have You brought trouble to the woman I am staying with, by making her son die?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he lay upon the child three times and called to the Lord, saying, “O Lord my God, I pray to You. Let this child’s life return to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord heard the voice of Elijah. And the life of the child returned to him and he became strong again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elijah took the child and brought him down from the second floor into the house and gave him to his mother. He said, “See, your son is alive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman said to Elijah, “Now I know that you are a man of God. Now I know that the word of the Lord in your mouth is truth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After many days, the word of the Lord came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, “Go show yourself to Ahab. And I will send rain upon the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Elijah went to show himself to Ahab. Now the time without food was very hard in Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ahab called Obadiah who was the boss over his house. (Now Obadiah had much fear of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when Jezebel destroyed the men who spoke for the Lord, Obadiah took 100 of these men and hid them by fifties in a cave. And he fed them with bread and water.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ahab said to Obadiah, “Go through the land to all the wells of water and to all the valleys. It may be that we will find grass and keep the horses and donkeys alive, and not lose some of the animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they divided the land between them to pass through it. Ahab went one way by himself. And Obadiah went another way by himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Obadiah was on the way, Elijah met him. Obadiah knew who he was, and fell on his face and said, “Is it you, my lord Elijah?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “It is I. Go and tell your owner, ‘See, Elijah is here.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obadiah said, “What sin have I done? Why are you giving your servant into the hand of Ahab to be killed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the Lord your God lives, there is no nation where the king has not sent men to look for you. And when they said, ‘He is not here,’ he made the nation prove that they could not find you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you are saying, ‘Go, say to your owner, “See, Elijah is here.” ‘
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after I have left you, the Spirit of the Lord will carry you where I do not know. So I will go and tell Ahab, and he will not be able to find you. Then he will kill me. But I your servant have honored the Lord since I was young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you not been told what I did when Jezebel killed the men who spoke for the Lord? I hid 100 men of the Lord by fifties in a cave. And I gave them bread and water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you are saying, ‘Go and tell your owner, “See, Elijah is here.”’ He will kill me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elijah said, “As the Lord of All lives, before Whom I stand, I will show myself to Ahab today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him. And Ahab went to meet Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Elijah, Ahab said to him, “Is it you, the one who brings trouble to Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elijah said, “I have not brought trouble to Israel. But you and your father’s house have. Because you have turned away from the laws of the Lord, and have followed the false gods of Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now call together all Israel to me at Mount Carmel. And gather together 450 men who speak for Baal and 400 men who speak for the false goddess Asherah, who eat at Jezebel’s table.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ahab sent news among all the people of Israel. And he brought the men who speak for the false gods together at Mount Carmel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elijah came near all the people and said, “How long will you be divided between two ways of thinking? If the Lord is God, follow Him. But if Baal is God, then follow him.” But the people did not answer him a word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah said to the people, “I am the only man left who speaks for God. But here are 450 men who speak for Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring two bulls to us. Let them choose one bull for themselves and cut it up and put it on the wood. But put no fire under it. I will make the other bull ready and lay it on the wood. And I will put no fire under it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you call on the name of your god, and I will call on the name of the Lord. The God Who answers by fire, He is God.” All the people answered and said, “That is a good idea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Elijah said to the men who spoke for Baal, “Choose one bull for yourselves and make it ready first. For there are many of you. Then call on the name of your god, but put no fire under it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took the bull which was given to them and made it ready. Then they called on the name of Baal from morning until noon, saying, “O Baal, answer us.” But there was no voice. No one answered. They jumped and danced around the altar they had made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At noon Elijah made fun of them. He said, “Call out with a loud voice, for he is a god. It might be that he is in deep thought or has turned away. He could be away traveling. Or it may be that he is asleep and needs to have someone wake him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they cried with a loud voice. They cut themselves as they had done in the past, with swords and spears until blood poured out on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When noon passed, they cried out until the time for giving the evening gift. But there was no voice. No one answered. No one listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah said to all the people, “Come near to me.” So all the people came near to him. And he built again the altar of the Lord which had been torn down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah took twelve stones, by the number of the families of Jacob’s sons. The word of the Lord had come to Jacob’s sons, saying, “Israel will be your name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the stones he built an altar in the name of the Lord. And he made a ditch around the altar, big enough to hold twenty-two jars of seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he set the wood in place. He cut the bull in pieces and laid it on the wood. And he said, “Fill four jars with water and pour it on the burnt gift and on the wood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Do it a second time.” And they did it a second time. He said, “Do it a third time.” And they did it a third time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The water flowed around the altar, and filled the ditch also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the time came for giving the evening gift. Elijah the man who spoke for God came near and said, “O Lord, God of Abraham, Isaac and Israel, let it be known today that You are God in Israel. Let it be known that I am Your servant, and have done all these things at Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Answer me, O Lord. Answer me so these people may know that You, O Lord, are God. Turn their hearts to You again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the fire of the Lord fell. It burned up the burnt gift, the wood, the stones and the dust. And it picked up the water that was in the ditch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people fell on their faces when they saw it. They said, “The Lord, He is God. The Lord, He is God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah said to them, “Take hold of the men who speak for Baal. Do not let one of them get away.” So they took hold of them. And Elijah brought them down to the river Kishon, and killed them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah said to Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink. For there is the sound of much rain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ahab went up to eat and drink. But Elijah went up to the top of Carmel. He got down on the ground and put his face between his knees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his servant, “Go up now and look toward the sea.” So he went up and looked and said, “There is nothing.” Seven times Elijah said, “Go again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh time, he said, “I see a cloud as small as a man’s hand coming up from the sea.” Elijah said, “Go and tell Ahab, ‘Make your war-wagon ready and go down, so that the rain does not stop you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon the sky became black with clouds and wind, and there was much rain. And Ahab went to Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the hand of the Lord was on Elijah. He pulled his clothing up under his belt and ran before Ahab to Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done. He told her how Elijah had killed with the sword all the men who spoke for Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jezebel sent news to Elijah, saying, “So may the gods do to me and even more, if I do not make your life as the life of one of them by this time tomorrow.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elijah was afraid. He got up and ran for his life. When he came to Beersheba of Judah, he left his servant there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he himself traveled for a day into the desert. He came and sat down under a juniper tree. There he asked that he might die, saying, “It is enough now, O Lord. Take my life. For I am not better than my fathers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he lay down and slept under the juniper tree, an angel touched him. The angel said to him, “Get up and eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah looked and saw by his head a loaf of bread made ready on hot stones, and a jar of water. So he ate and drank and lay down again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of the Lord came again a second time and touched him, and said, “Get up and eat. Because this traveling is too hard for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he got up and ate and drank. And he went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights to Horeb, the mountain of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to a cave, and stayed there. The word of the Lord came to him, and said, “What are you doing here, Elijah?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elijah said, “I have been very careful to serve the Lord, the God of All. For the people of Israel have turned away from Your agreement. They have torn down Your altars and have killed with the sword the men who speak for You. Only I am left, and they want to kill me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the angel said, “Go and stand on the mountain before the Lord.” And the Lord passed by. A strong wind tore through the mountains and broke the rocks in pieces before the Lord. But the Lord was not in the wind. After the wind the earth shook. But the Lord was not in the shaking of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the earth shook, a fire came. But the Lord was not in the fire. And after the fire came a sound of gentle blowing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Elijah heard it, he put his coat over his face, and went out and stood at the opening of the hole. Then a voice came to him and said, “What are you doing here, Elijah?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I have been very careful to serve the Lord, the God of All. For the people of Israel have turned away from Your agreement. They have torn down Your altars. And they have killed with the sword the men who speak for You. Only I am left, and they want to kill me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to him, “Go, return on your way to the desert of Damascus. When you get there, set apart Hazael to be the king of Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set apart Nimshi’s son Jehu to be the king of Israel. And set apart Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abel-meholah to speak for God in your place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehu will kill the one who gets away from the sword of Hazael. Elisha will kill the one who gets away from the sword of Jehu.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will leave 7,000 in Israel whose knees have not bowed down in front of Baal and whose mouths have not kissed him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Elijah left there and found Elisha the son of Shaphat. Elisha was plowing with twenty-four bulls, and was with the last two. Elijah passed by him and threw his coat on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he left the bulls and ran after Elijah and said, “Let me kiss my father and mother. Then I will follow you.” And Elijah said to him, “Return. For what have I done to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Elisha returned from following him. He took his two bulls and killed them. Then he boiled their flesh over a fire, burning the wood cross-pieces the bulls used to pull the load. And he gave the meat to the people, and they ate. Then Elisha got up and followed Elijah and served him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ben-hadad king of Syria gathered all his army together. Thirty-two kings were with him, and horses and war-wagons. And he went up against Samaria in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent men with news to the city of Ahab king of Israel, saying, “This is what Ben-hadad says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ’Your silver and gold are mine. Your most beautiful wives and children are mine also.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Israel answered, “It is as you say, my lord, O king. I am yours, and all that I have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men returned and said, “This is what Ben-hadad says. ‘I sent word to you saying, “You must give me your silver and gold and your wives and children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will send my servants to you tomorrow about this time. They will look through your house and the houses of your servants. And they will take away all that is of worth to you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Israel called all the leaders of the land. He said to them, “Look and see how this man is looking for trouble. He sent to me for my wives and my children, my silver and my gold. And I did not say no to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the leaders and all the people said to him, “Do not listen or agree.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ahab said to Benhadad’s men, “Tell my lord the king, ‘I will do all that you first asked of your servant, but this I cannot do.’” The men left and returned again with news for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ben-hadad sent word to him saying, “May the gods do so to me and more also, if the dust of Samaria will be enough to fill the hands of all the people who follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Israel answered and said, “Tell him, ‘Let not him who dresses in battle-clothes talk with pride like him who takes them off.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Ben-hadad heard these words, he was drinking with the kings in the tents. He said to his servants, “Go to your places.” So they went to their place of battle against the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a man who spoke for God came to Ahab king of Israel and said, “This is what the Lord says. ‘Have you seen all these many people? See, I will give them to you today. Then you will know that I am the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahab said, “By whom?” So he told him, “The Lord says, ‘By the young servants of the leaders of the lands you rule.’” Then Ahab said, “Who will start the battle?” And he answered, “You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ahab called together the young servants of the leaders of the nations, 232 men. And he called together all the people of Israel, 7,000 men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out at noon, while Ben-hadad was drinking himself drunk in the tents with the thirty-two kings who helped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young servants of the leaders of the lands went out first. Ben-hadad sent men out to get news, and they told him, “Men have come out from Samaria.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “If they have come out for peace or for war, take them alive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the young servants of the leaders of the lands went out from the city, and the army which followed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each one killed his man. The Syrians ran away, and Israel went after them. And Ben-hadad king of Syria got away on a horse with horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Israel went out and destroyed the horses and war-wagons. He killed many of the Syrians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man who spoke for God came to the king of Israel, and said to him, “Go and make yourself strong. Look and see what you have to do. For the first of next year the king of Syria will come to fight against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the servants of the king of Syria said to him, “Israel’s gods are gods of the mountains. So they were stronger than we. But let us fight against them in the plain, and for sure we will be stronger than they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do this. Take each of the kings from his place, and put captains in their places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gather together an army like the army you lost, horse for horse, and war-wagon for war-wagon. Then we will fight against Israel in the plain. For sure we will be stronger than they.” And Ben-hadad listened to them and did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the new year came, Benhadad called together the Syrians and went up to Aphek to fight against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel were called together and given what they needed, and went to meet them. The people of Israel gathered in front of them like two little flocks of goats. But the Syrians filled the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a man who spoke for God came to the king of Israel and said, “This is what the Lord says. ‘The Syrians have said, “The Lord is a god of the mountains, but He is not a god of the valleys.” So I will give all these many people to you. Then you will know that I am the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they stayed beside each other for seven days. On the seventh day the battle was fought. And the people of Israel killed 100,000 Syrian foot soldiers in one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the rest ran away into the city of Aphek. And the wall fell on 27,000 men who were left. Ben-hadad ran away and came to a room in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His servants said to him, “Now see, we have heard that the kings of the family of Israel are kings who show kindness. Let us dress in cloth made from hair and put ropes on our heads, and go out to the king of Israel. It might be that he will save your life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they dressed in cloth made from hair and put ropes on their heads, and went to the king of Israel. They said to him, “Your servant Ben-hadad says, ‘I beg you, let me live.’” Ahab said, “Is he still alive? He is my brother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the men were watching for something special to happen. They were quick to catch his word, and said, “Yes, your brother Ben-hadad.” Then Ahab said, “Go and bring him.” So Ben-hadad came out to him, and Ahab took him up into the war-wagon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ben-hadad said to him, “I will return to you the cities which my father took from your father. And you will make streets for yourself in Damascus, as my father made in Samaria.” Ahab said, “I will let you go with this agreement.” So he made an agreement with him and let him go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain son of the men who spoke for God said to another by the word of the Lord, “Hit me.” But the man would not hit him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to him, “Because you have not listened to the voice of the Lord, as soon as you have left me, a lion will kill you.” And as soon as he had left him, a lion found him and killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he found another man and said, “Hit me.” And the man hit him, and hurt him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man of God left, and waited for the king by the way. He tied a cloth over his eyes so no one would know him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the king passed by, he cried to the king and said, “Your servant went out to the battle. A soldier turned and brought a man to me, and said, ‘Keep this man. If he is missing for any reason, you will pay for his life with your own. Or else you must pay a man’s weight in silver.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while your servant was doing things here and there, the man got away.” The king of Israel said to him, “So you must be punished. You yourself have decided it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a hurry the man took the cloth away from his eyes. And the king of Israel saw that he was one of the men who speak for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man said to him, “This is what the Lord says. ‘You have let the man go whom I had given to be destroyed. So you will pay for his life with your own. And your people will pay for his people.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king of Israel went home sad and angry, and came to Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Naboth the Jezreelite had a field of grape-vines in Jezreel beside the family of Ahab king of Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahab said to Naboth, “Give me your grape-field. I want it for a vegetable garden because it is near my house. I will give you a better field for it. Or I will pay for it with money, if you like.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Naboth said to Ahab, “May the Lord keep me from giving you what I have received from my fathers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahab went into his house sad and angry because of Naboth the Jezreelite saying to him, “I will not give you what I have received from my fathers.” And Ahab lay down on his bed and turned his face away and would not eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His wife Jezebel came to him and said, “Why is your spirit so troubled that you are not eating food?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Because I spoke to Naboth the Jezreelite. I said to him, ‘Give me your grape-field for money. Or I will give you another field for it, if you like.’ But he said, ‘I will not give you my grape-field.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jezebel his wife said to him, “Do you now rule over Israel? Get up, eat food, and let your heart be filled with joy. I will give you the grape-field of Naboth the Jezreelite.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she wrote letters in Ahab’s name and put the mark of his name on them. She sent letters to the leaders and the king’s sons who were living with Naboth in his city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She wrote in the letters, saying, “Tell the people that it is a time when they should not eat. And put Naboth in front of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seat two men of no worth beside him. And have them speak against him, saying, ‘You spoke against God and the king.’ Then take him out and kill him with stones.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the leaders and king’s sons who lived in Naboth’s city did just as Jezebel had written to them in the letters she had sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told the people that it was a time when they should not eat. And they put Naboth in front of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the two men of no worth came in and sat beside him. These men spoke against Naboth in front of the people, saying, “Naboth spoke against God and the king.” So they took him outside the city and killed him with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sent news to Jezebel, saying, “Naboth has been killed with stones. He is dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jezebel heard that Naboth had been killed with stones, she said to Ahab, “Get up and take the grape-field of Naboth the Jezreelite for your own, the field he would not sell to you. For Naboth is not alive, but dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, he got up to go down and take for his own the grape-field of Naboth the Jezreelite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get ready and go down to Samaria to meet Ahab king of Israel. He is in Naboth’s grape-field. He has gone down to take it for his own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will speak to him, saying, ‘This is what the Lord says, “Have you killed and also taken away?” And you will speak to him, saying, “This is what the Lord says, ‘The dogs will drink up your blood in the place where the dogs drank up the blood of Naboth.’”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahab said to Elijah, “Have you found me, O you who hate me?” Elijah answered, “I have found you, because you have sold yourself to do what is sinful in the eyes of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I will bring trouble upon you. I will destroy you. I will kill every male of Ahab in Israel, both those who are servants and those who are free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make your house like the family of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and like the family of Baasha the son of Ahijah. Because you have made Me angry, and have made Israel sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord has spoken about Jezebel, saying, ‘The dogs will eat Jezebel in the land of Jezreel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The dogs will eat anyone belonging to Ahab who dies in the city. The birds of the air will eat anyone belonging to Ahab who dies in the field.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was no one who sold himself to do what is sinful in the eyes of the Lord like Ahab did. His wife Jezebel moved him to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did what was hated by following false gods. He did all that the Amorites had done, whom the Lord drove out in front of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Ahab heard these words, he tore his clothes and dressed in cloth made from hair, and would not eat. He lay dressed in cloth made from hair, and went about very sad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do you see how Ahab has got rid of his pride before Me? Because he has gotten rid of his pride, I will not bring trouble to him while he is alive. But I will bring trouble upon his house in his son’s days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three years passed without war between Syria and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the third year, Jehoshaphat the king of Judah came down to the king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Israel said to his servants, “Do you know that Ramothgilead belongs to us? We are still doing nothing to take it from the king of Syria.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to Jehoshaphat, “Will you go with me to battle at Ramoth-gilead?” Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, “I am as you are. My people are as your people. My horses are as your horses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, “Ask first for the word of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Israel gathered together the men who spoke for God, 400 men. He said to them, “Should I go to Ramoth-gilead to battle, or should I not?” And they said, “Go. For the Lord will give it to the king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jehoshaphat said, “Is there not another man who speaks for the Lord here, that we may ask him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “There is only one other man whom we may ask of the Lord, but I hate him. He does not speak anything good about me, only bad. He is Micaiah the son of Imlah.” But Jehoshaphat said, “Let not the king say that.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Israel called a soldier and said, “Be quick to bring Micaiah the son of Imlah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah were sitting on their thrones, dressed in their king’s clothing. They sat at the grain-floor at the gate of Samaria. All the men who speak for God were speaking in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made horns of iron for himself and said, “The Lord says, ‘With these you will fight the Syrians until they are destroyed.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the men who spoke for God said so. They said, “Go up to Ramoth-gilead and do well. For the Lord will give it to the king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who went to call Micaiah said to him, “See, the words of those who speak for God are all in the king’s favor. Let your words be like theirs and speak in favor of the king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Micaiah said, “As the Lord lives, I will say what the Lord says to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Micaiah came to the king. And the king said to him, “Micaiah, should we go to Ramothgilead to battle, or should we not?” He answered, “Go up and do well. The Lord will give it to the king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said to him, “How many times must I tell you to speak nothing but the truth in the name of the Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Micaiah said, “I saw all Israel spread upon the mountains like sheep which have no shepherd. And the Lord said, ‘These have no owner. Let each of them return to his house in peace.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “Did I not tell you that he would not speak good of me, but bad?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Micaiah said, “So hear the word of the Lord. I saw the Lord sitting on His throne. All those in heaven were standing by Him on His right and on His left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, ‘Who will lead Ahab to go up and die at Ramoth-gilead?’ And one said one thing, and another said another thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a spirit came and stood before the Lord and said, ‘I will lead him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to him, ‘How?’ And he said, ‘I will go out and be a lying spirit in the mouth of all those who will tell what will happen in the future.’ Then the Lord said, ‘You are to lead him, and do well. Go and do so.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now see, the Lord has put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these who tell what will happen in the future. The Lord has said bad things against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came and hit Micaiah on the face and said, “How did the Spirit of the Lord go from me to speak to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Micaiah said, “See, you will see on that day when you go into a room to hide yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Israel said, “Take Micaiah and return him to Amon the leader of the city and to Joash the king’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them, ‘The king says, “Put this man in prison and feed him with little bread and water, until I return in peace.” ‘ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Micaiah said, “If you do return in peace, then the Lord has not spoken by me.” And he said, “Listen, all you people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “I will dress so no one will know who I am, and will go to battle. But you put on your king’s clothing.” So the king of Israel dressed so no one would know who he was, and went into battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the king of Syria had told the thirty-two captains of his war-wagons, “Do not fight with the small or strong. But only fight with the king of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the captains of the war-wagons saw Jehoshaphat, they said, “For sure this is the king of Israel.” And they turned to fight against him, and Jehoshaphat cried out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the captains of the war-wagons saw that it was not the king of Israel. So they returned from going after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a certain man happened to shoot an arrow and hit the king of Israel between the parts of his battle-clothes. So Ahab said to the driver of his war-wagon, “Turn around and take me out of the battle. For I am hurt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The battle was hard that day, and the king was set up in his war-wagon in front of the Syrians. At evening he died. The blood from the cut flowed to the bottom of the war-wagon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a cry went through to his country!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king died and was brought to Samaria. They buried the king in Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they washed the war-wagon by the pool of Samaria. The dogs drank up his blood. (The women who sold the use of their bodies washed themselves there.) It happened as the word of the Lord said it would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Ahab and all he did, the ivory house and cities he built, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahab died and his son Ahaziah became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoshaphat the son of Asa became the king of Judah in the fourth year of Ahab king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoshaphat was thirty-five years old when he became king. And he ruled twenty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He walked in all the way of Asa his father. He did not turn aside from it. He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord. But the high places were not taken away. The people still gave gifts and burned special perfume on the high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehoshaphat made peace with the king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, the strength he showed and how he fought, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He destroyed from the land those who were left of the men who sold the use of their bodies in their religion during the days of his father Asa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was no king in Edom. A leader was acting as king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoshaphat made ships of Tarshish to go to Ophir for gold. But they did not go. For the ships were wrecked at Ezion-geber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ahab’s son Ahaziah said to Jehoshaphat, “Let my servants go with your servants in the ships.” But Jehoshaphat was not willing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehoshaphat died and was buried with his fathers in the city of his father David. Jehoram his son became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahab’s son Ahaziah became the king of Israel in Samaria in the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah. And he ruled Israel for two years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did what was sinful in the eyes of the Lord. He walked in the way of his father and mother, and Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who caused Israel to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He served the false god Baal and worshiped him. He made the Lord God of Israel angry in every way his father had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator
